circumstances: The crew departed Roosevelt Field, New York, at 2000LT on September 12 to take part to an air race. While cruising by night over State of Indiana, the crew encountered engine problems and attempted an emergency landing. The aircraft crashed in a farmland located near Geneva, about 15 miles south of Decatur. The wreckage was found by a farmer around 0600LT. Both occupants, pilots William Thaw and John P. Morris, were seriously injured.
probable_cause: Engine problems following a broken oil line in flight.
